website_summaries.verdict: A budget option made specifically for bathroom use in spaces up to 65 square feet in area.
pros: Combines a 1,300-watt heater with a 100-watt light bulb and fan
Bath fan helps to circulate fresh air through the bathroom
Compatible with most bathroom spaces without extensive modifications
cons: Can sound loud during normal use

customer_reviews.title: Help
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very neat, sleek and compact. Very good fit for my bathroom. It was installed in May, and we had a very hot summer, so the heat function wasn't used much until mid October. That function has already burned out, and with winter almost here, I'm going to need it soon. I'm concerned as to how to proceed from here. I'll be without a light and fan too, if I remove the unit to send back for a replacement. Help!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three in One  - Broan 655 Heater / Bath Fan with Light
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I was looking for. This Broan 655 Heater / Bath Fan with Light has all three in one. I am very pleased with this purchase. Heater provides heat, fan gets rid of steam from shower all with built in light. Excellent item and highly recommended as mine is working fine. I had to have electrician install it, so beware you may need one too.
customer_reviews.author: Bottm4UBoy

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Loud
customer_reviews.text: This item is incredibly loud, both the fan and the heater. Unusually, unbearably, teeth-chatteringly loud. And, to add to the fun, it actually vibrates such that the vibrations can be felt through the floor above. Functionally speaking, it's fine, but unless you want a simulation of a jet engine in your bathroom or wherever, I wouldn't recommend your buying it. (In case you were wondering, yes, the fan was indeed installed correctly.)
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C.C.

customer_reviews.title: NIce unit, difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: The unit works fine and is not very loud. I wanted to retrofit an existing exhaust-only fan. Installation was extremely difficult as this is apparently designed only for new / remodel installations by experienced contractors. The directions are very sparse too, reflecting that.
customer_reviews.author: Morbious

customer_reviews.title: Bathroom Combo Ceiling Light/Vent/Heater
customer_reviews.text: It sucks, blows hot and shines; just what I wanted. Could be quieter, but then maybe some fools would walk out and leave it running. Good performance versus cost. I had more work than average because I was upgrading from a smaller ceiling fan/light, thus I had to enlarge the hole and run better AC power, but that no reflection on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Price

customer_reviews.title: Cannot install despite hours of effort
customer_reviews.text: The wiring diagram is the problem. The colors did not match those in my house wiring. Despite persistent effort--and about 4-5 hours of work--to try combinations of wiring hookups I never succeeded in getting it to work. It has been sitting on the shelf now for weeks. I called several electricians and none would come out for this sort of job as it doesn't pay them enough. Unless you are an electrician save your money. I have installed numerous ceiling fans and light fixtures in the past with no difficulty. This was well beyond my skill set.
customer_reviews.author: Rexford

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for older single unit or separate fan, light and heater equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased (3) of the Broan bathroom fan/light/heater units. At our local construction/lumber stores I paid $119.00 for these units. But my last purchase with Amazon.com, for the exact same unit, was $59.98. Quite a savings compared to the stores. Plus the convenience of having it delivered within two days of purchase with Amazon Prime is an added bonus. The unit itself is fantastic for remodeling an older outdated unit. I'm replacing an old exhaust fan and a huge 3 bulb/heat lamp type unit. The switches were already wired into the wall so all I had to do was rewire the existing wiring to the new unit, plus some sheetrock work, but that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: James Ziessler

customer_reviews.title: Heaters broken
customer_reviews.text: We bought three of these for our large master bath to replace Broan-NuTone heaters installed in 2008. The heaters didn't even work for a week. My electrician came by today and said an internal fuse popped on all three. I'm very disappointed in the lack of quality and will return the units to purchase a higher quality unit. The exhaust fans were exceptionally loud compared with the models we replaced.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Great fan and heater, plenty of light.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in a 12x7 bathroom in my basement, the unit provided plenty of heat. We use this in addition to 1 4” recessed light and it is a good amount of light, provides enough heat for the space as well. The instructions are not written great for the average DIYer with little experience, so i had my father-in-law who is an electrician install it. The fan and heater are a little loud but for the cost that is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Garbage... Save your money. I made this mistake twice.
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact unit in my small restroom and the heater quit working and burned out. I bought this same unit a second time and within 2 1/2 years with minimal use, the heater burned out again. I noticed a burnt, electrical smell and noticed the heater was no longer operational. Save yourself the time and headache of this device. It’s cheap, and obviously Broen does not care about the quality of product they put out.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Roger Roger do you copy? Ready for takeoff!
customer_reviews.text: I only realized the unit had some negative reviews for the sound level after taking delivery, struggling with the install onmy own, and hiring a contractor electrician to upgrade my board and wiring to 20 amp regulations ~550 😔. Everything works As it should and the install is solid and tight but the sound/noise level is too much and prevents all conversation from or to the bathroom from even the adjoining rooms 😟😟 will be searching for another Panasonic like we have elsewhere. The two are night and day...
customer_reviews.author: CSL

customer_reviews.title: Nice vent/heat fan for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, my husband had no issue with installation and functions well. It’s not particularly loud or quiet based on our previous experience with bath fans. It was a bit dim with a standard bulb so got a daylight version and that helped brighten it up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for component replacement
customer_reviews.text: I used the components of this unit to replace the components on a 20 year old Nautilus unit. The modular style components with plug-style wiring made the replacement process a breeze. I didn’t even need to get in the attic for the project, although a new install would have been much more tedious with drywall cutting and exhaust piping. It’s great that they are still making a version of this unit so homeowners don’t need to start from scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Easy To install ,Great product line!
customer_reviews.text: I had good expectations buying the exact replacement vent for my home. While the duct and vent can were in excellent condition, there was no need to remove the entire originally vent. This allowed me to swap the heater,vent fan/light components exceptionally fast. All screw holes/hangers aligned perfectly! One of the few times anything goes as planned. 45 minutes later I was returning my tools and ladder with a job completely finished! Research your model number first before ordering a replacement for the easiest repair you'll ever do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: This heater/vent/light works great! I've read where some have said it was loud, but this one is not any different than the one we changed out. The noise level is not loud, in my opinion! It does the job it was made to do! I just hope it lasts as long as the one we replaced that was over 20yrs old! It was an exact model & fit! Easy installation for my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Kay D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to repair your Broan exhaust fan...
customer_reviews.text: Our 25 year old exhaust fan's heater had died. Easier to purchase this as a complete unit rather than just getting a replacement heater unit. Thankfully Broan has kept the sizes and mounting tabs the same all these years. New heater is a direct drop/plug in. Now I have a spare exhaust fan if I ever need it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Willie S. Tyndall Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Heater is loud
customer_reviews.text: Exhaust fan is average noise level heater is loud still debating if I will replace it’s pretty damn loud don’t know if I can make it any quieter by tightening anything up but the light works in the exhaust fan works as expected
customer_reviews.author: cory a leinweber

customer_reviews.title: Caution_internal wiring should be improved
customer_reviews.text: See attached wiring that supplies power to the heater plug. IMHO it should be heavier gauge and/or solid copper. Some might say this constitutes a fire hazard. Luckily I caught it in time and the clue was the terrible odor from the burning wire and plug.
customer_reviews.author: GreggT

customer_reviews.title: I have only had mine installed and using for two weeks BUT return or repair
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed,,because ONLY one side puts out heat. The other side does great. I wanted to call Broan-NuTone direct but do not have their number. I hope it can be adjusted as I dislike returning. This must be corrected because I live in South Texas and it is warm here now. I am very cold in the shower since there is NO HEAT and I cannot imagine using it in winter.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy T.

customer_reviews.title: This arrived with broken motor
customer_reviews.text: I just paid an electrician to install this exhaust fan heater and the motor is broken! Now I have to pay to have him remove the motor, diagnose the problem, have him come back out to re-install and they charge $120 per hour. I will be talking to Broan customer service tomorrow and see what they can do to compensate me.
customer_reviews.author: Kimber Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, easy to install yet it's priced too high
customer_reviews.text: NOISE ~ Too bad this unit would be offered in a lower sones rating as an option INSTALL ~ If you can work a screwdriver, you can install the components in this kit Value ~ Broan charges way too much for what you get. Since the years old fan was making noise and I wanted to replace the beige grill with white, I had limited options. .
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Heat!  Glorious, wonderful heat!
customer_reviews.text: The Broan 655 Heat/Fan/Light is the most wonderful thing I have ever bought in my entire life. I ordered it with the suggested 3 way switch and had it professionally installed. Now heat...glorious wonderful heat...pours down out of the ceiling in my bathroom. I go in there sometimes now and never want to leave. Thank you, Broan! Oh and the light and fan work great.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Nocella

customer_reviews.title: Good for parts!  As described.
customer_reviews.text: If replacing same unit you have to go thru attic or floor above the ceiling in which this unit is installed. That said, Electrican who installed this literally gutted the old unit and used the parts from the new unit to replace. My only other option was to remove the floor from above and that would have added incredible cost and effort.
customer_reviews.author: 69 Camaro

customer_reviews.title: Vent is loud, but works great
customer_reviews.text: Had a similar model. Noted the power connector to the heater unit was melted, so replaced it and rewired it (received it with the house 7 years ago). Haven't used the heater, but the vent really moves the air. It is a little on the loud side, but the old one wasn't quiet either, and this one works a lot better. Overall, satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rigby

customer_reviews.title: LOUD !
customer_reviews.text: Vent fan is louder than expected. The heater is out of balance or something. Everything is tight but the fan vibrates too much to use.
customer_reviews.author: MJK

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: Finally installed it, the heater turned on the houseing got red hot and the plastic outside covering started to melt, thankfully I was watching it or this could of been real bad! If I hadn’t been paying attention my whole house would of caught fire, how in 15 seconds does the plastic start covering start to melt and smoke fill the home!
customer_reviews.author: beau leimbach

customer_reviews.title: The heater part is great, but the exhaust fan also sucks heat out when both are being used.
customer_reviews.text: It heats up my bathroom well and isn’t too noisy. It was expensive to install because a separate electrical line had to be added or it would have blown the fuse (but that is because of how my house is wired). The extra light is great in the shower, but the vent fan also sucks heat out. A separate wall heater might have been a better choice for added heat, if you have room in your bathroom (I didn’t).
customer_reviews.author: Jackie van Zwoll

customer_reviews.title: Versatile bath fan/heater and light
customer_reviews.text: Heater unit melts the grill after a few years of use. But I leave the heater on longer than a casual user would. I just gut the machine and replace it's heater and fan and light with new grill about every 4-5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Gaskin

customer_reviews.title: Parts fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: A much newer version than what was installed when the house was built (1988) but the parts from this unit fit perfectly into the old one. Needing a fan and a light lense it was cheaper to buy this and cannibalize it than buying the parts individually. And I didn't have to get up in the attic to replace the entire unit.
customer_reviews.author: lostburro

customer_reviews.title: This unit works great. Our new house only had a 60cfm exhaust ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great. Our new house only had a 60cfm exhaust fan and had no heat. This unit does the trick. We had the same unit in our old house for 30 years, and never gave any trouble. It's also easy to retrofit if you have access above the ceiling and can get a 20 amp circuit to the heater part. I installed a wall thermostat to control the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: no major complaints
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a replacement for another unit of comparable size and functionality. So far, this unit has functioned as expected and I have no complaints on performance. I'm marking this as a 4 star because of the wiring and installation setup. It's not as easy of an install as you think it would be due to the way the side brackets mount on it. The connection points to the wires were also a little shorter than expected and required additional wiring to be purchased for easier wiring. The wiring point is not housed within a protective box, so if that bothers you I would suggest another product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Vents great!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive - the volume of air it moves is amazing -- makes me realize how bad my last one was and it says it is not quiet -- it is noisy! In this case I am okay with that and if you have other lighting you should consider not putting in a light bulb, as it is on with the fan,
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Good heater/fan
customer_reviews.text: Good unit. Easy to install in new construction, difficult to install in an existing structure. If you have an older model, there isn’t much difference and the main can has not changed at all, so you can just swap parts if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Barcelo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: It has a fan, heater and light. The heater stopped working within a few months of installation and I didn’t see that it was powerful because my bathroom ceiling still got a little bit of mold even though it was turned on during every shower. I don’t recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Moni_Bling

customer_reviews.title: Almost zero exhaust flow. Heater flow adequate
customer_reviews.text: Although difficult and tight to install, it went in. Both fans are pretty loud. !EXHAUST HAS almost ZERO FLOW!. Not even enough to open the plastic louvered vent cover. Yes, it has a turning fan. -- It must be rotating backwards
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty same as it’s been for 30 years. Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a 30 old model and was pleased to find out I could just use the motors and not replace the whole unit. Was cheaper to buy the whole thing rather than individual parts! Very pleased! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: unbelievable value
customer_reviews.text: got a fan, heater and light for price of fan and light at big box store. heater kicks plenty of heat for bathroom. nice light and fan works well. had someone else install but they said it was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Kari H.

customer_reviews.title: Heater goes out like clockwork every 5 years. Otherwise it’s really good .
customer_reviews.text: I had this fan/heater combo for many years. And the heater goes out in it every 5 years. I’m on my third heater. Thankfully it’s 2 screws and a plug to change out. Pretty easy. Heater by itself is 75 bones without tax. New exhaust is a little more. I always purchase a complete set up and replace both the exhaust and heater . Only the guys, I leave the body in place . The designers made this extremely serviceable.
customer_reviews.author: I like it -!

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. $229 for similar model at lowes. Works well thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Esoch

customer_reviews.title: After connecting all the wires and air duct I turned on the switches and everything worked fine. It's a great little light/fan/h
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the same unit that had both fans and heater coil that stopped working. After receiving the new unit I opened the old one a saw why the old one stopped working. I used butt splice terminals instead of screw on winged wire connectors. I doubt the wires will come loose this time. After connecting all the wires and air duct I turned on the switches and everything worked fine. It's a great little light/fan/heater unit with a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Whole lot going on!
customer_reviews.text: There is a LOT happening here, in a SMALL space. This unit can (and should) be switched for each of its three functions: ceiling light, ventilation fan, and a heater for cold mornings. It does all three functions quite well, as you might expect from the Broan brand.
customer_reviews.author: tomtees

customer_reviews.title: Broan stands behind their products
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because my sister has one and really likes it. But when mine was installed, the heater made twice as much noise as my sister’s. I contacted Broan technical support through Amazon, and I could not have been more delighted with the help provided. They shipped me a new heating unit, then walked me through the installation. Everything works great!
customer_reviews.author: Leeda A. Laykasek

customer_reviews.title: Installation was easy. The unit hasn't changed in years
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older model of this unit with this one. Installation was easy. The unit hasn't changed in years. I took the individual parts out of the new unit's housing and installed them directly into the old housing. No need to remove the old housing as the parts were completely interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen N.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Alot quieter than our other fan/vent that we had and it was Brand new. Also it heats up our bathroom. Not a huge amount of heat but enough to take the chill out of the air. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: But one makes a decent product. I recommend it if you want a value fan with heater. It’s the best I found for the money and quality
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: It heats and it vents 😷
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an (much) older model because ours burnt up. Easy to install. Didnt realize how loud or how poorly our old one really was until we installed this one.
customer_reviews.author: N. ARIAS

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.....
customer_reviews.text: ... but noisier than the fan it replaced. Will admit that the old fan was not as powerful as the new purchase, probably the reasoning why the noise level is higher.
customer_reviews.author: Rus O.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being a bit noisy, this is a decent heater/fan. The design hasn't changed over many years. The original I bought was a Nautilus, and this Broan is the exact same thing. I actually bought this to replace the heater in my old, currently mounted unit. It's ultra easy to replace the old with a new one taken from this new full assembly. Heck, it's smarter to buy a whole new heater/fan assembly instead of a single part. It's more economical that way.
customer_reviews.author: DALMN

customer_reviews.title: Dependable but a bit loud.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in bathroom. This model has not changed in at least a couple of decades. Heat components work very well n relatively quiet. Suction fan is very powerful but very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just have the unit installed and have no complaints. Some of the reviews said there’s a problem with noise but no more than expected. Great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: patricia jung

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I ve purchase these for work and for my own home so far they work great an clients are pleased. Heats well and last
customer_reviews.author: Brad B.

customer_reviews.title: Sucks Really Well
customer_reviews.text: Clears out a 8x10 bathroom after taking the Browns to the Super Bowl pretty well, no need to use air freshener
customer_reviews.author: njep

customer_reviews.title: Broan 655 Heater and Heater Bath Fan with Light Combination
customer_reviews.text: We have had this unit in our house for over 15 years. The fan motor was used every day as the primary exhaust fan in our bath room. The Fan motor finally gave out. Instead of buying a new motor for a few dollars more I ordered the exact same model from Amazon. Replaced all the internals Fan, Heat, Light with the new parts and works fine. Hopefully for another 15 years. I just didn't cherish the idea of crawling into the attic and trying to change out a new box that likely would not fit my existing opening. Simple solution that saves time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Cox, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Got the fan started to install and the red plug to plug in the fan is missing,had to use the old one.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth himes

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Three functions: light, heat, vent fan. Two switches. You do the math. However, it's in and its staying.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Reader

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of these bathroom fans. They are loud when you turn them on and louder when you turn the heater on.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Marechal

customer_reviews.title: Broan had been a winner for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm spoiled and can't live without my bathroom heater! This is a nice combo light/fan/heater product. I have a large bathroom and with the door closed it heats the whole room nicely. Others complain about noise level--the heater is a little louder than the fan, but let's face it, you are usually in the shower or just warming up the bathroom. It's not like it's on for hours or you are trying to hold a conversation while it's running. I only gave it 4 stars because my first one lasted 8 years and the second one only lasted 4...it is the main bathroom for the two adults in the household and gets daily use. Overall, I'm satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Hooty

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This product is hard to find in stores where I live and when I do find it I can’t find it this cheap it is a great replacement for the one I had

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but you need ceiling access.
customer_reviews.text: I got creative, and made it work, but this is not designed to be installed without access to the ceiling.

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Needed the heat for winter. Did not fit hole. Had to have installed by an electrician.

customer_reviews.text: Have one already & this will replace it, great in winter when you need a little warmth in the bathroom, renovating, old one turned yellow after 10+ years.

customer_reviews.title: Quality ITEM
customer_reviews.text: I loved the price. The heater, blower and exhaust do the job for my 2nd bath with no windows

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this to replace the unit in my master ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace the unit in my master bath. I ended up just taking out the individual components and replacing the malfunctioning parts in the ceiling. Much easier than trying to reinstall the entire unit.

customer_reviews.text: Good price on these units which perfectly replaced my 25 yr old Broans

customer_reviews.text: Everything works great. 12.9Amps allowing me to add it to existing circuit without any worry.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the heater and the fan and not the entire assembly box
customer_reviews.text: Replacing the heater and the fan and not the entire assembly box took less than 30 minutes. We replaced two 20 year old Broan 655 heaters and fans that both had heaters that recently quit. We purchased 2 complete units to also update the 20 year old grills with the more modern look. This is a good example to purchase a well established brand like Broan that was still making the same model 20 years later.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, gives a mild heat output
customer_reviews.text: While its not top of the line, this economical kit does exactly what I wanted it for. Works fine, gives a mild heat output. Yes it's a bit noisy, but I don't live in the bathroom. To those that purchase the 655, do your diligence, The higher the Sone, the louder it is, I see people mention that way to often in reviews.

customer_reviews.title: Except for exterior cosmetics, the unit was identical to ...
customer_reviews.text: Except for exterior cosmetics, the unit was identical to one I bought around 20 years ago. Housing and wiring did not have to be changed. The fan, heater and light receptical are all separate units. Loosened two screws and unplugged and replaced the 3 units. and was finished. Replace exterior grill. Finished. Since I did not have to mess with the housing or wiring the job only took 20 minutes tops.

customer_reviews.title: Ovenight delivery.

customer_reviews.text: It was a perfect plug and play for my 30 year old broan fan. Not sure why all the complaints I read prior to purchasing. customer_reviews.title: Wife is happy now!

customer_reviews.title: Go for an upgrade model.
customer_reviews.text: My builder installed this model and the heater went out within two years. The fan is EXTREMELY loud. The light, is fine, just a light. I like having a heater/fan/light combo, but would prefer a higher grade model if given the choice next time. I had to buy the model again so I could salvage the heater (cheaper than buying the heater component by itself).

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Good Price

customer_reviews.title: The Broan 655 is a replacement for a previous one ...
customer_reviews.text: The Broan 655 is a replacement for a previous one which finally bought the dust after many years of making my bathroom warm and moisture free. The new one is the same except for the cover which is a new design and seems to take longer to warm the room and does not disperse the heat as quickly as the old design did. The unit was delivered sooner than expected and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install. Just swap out the contents of the box and install in the housing of old box. Get help from a second person if you are climbing high on a ladder. Taking pictures of the old and new device before you start the installation helps too.

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one bathroom fixture.

customer_reviews.text: We got these for parts for our older fans--the parts fit perfectly. We replaced the fan in one of our bathrooms and it is identical to the ones we have in our house. Now we have parts when something else goes out.

customer_reviews.text: I installed the original box for this lite/heater/fan 30 years ago. I am glad they are still made because when the heater goes out I just replace it. This item is not installed in a very friendly environment. However, I consider it a good value and have for a very long time.

customer_reviews.title: Per my hubby - easy installation: )

customer_reviews.title: Big mistake
customer_reviews.text: Replaced existing heater/fan which was the same model as this one. The first one was satisfactory, so I bought this Broan 655 again to save having to retrofit another model in the ceiling. The noise is enough to make on wear ear plugs. Dreadful sounding, especially when the heater is turned. Wasted money on this purchase. Will not use this brand again. Would not recommend this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Customer Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and installed it for a customer of my Handyman business. It was the only one that I could find at a reasonable price that was powered by 240v. The old heater was also run off of 240v with thermostat control and we did not want to run a new circuit with 110v. The heater worked great and the customer was highly satisfied with the results.
